formalpara.title: Figure 8. Wild-type (top) and pseudogamous (bottom) form of P. pellio after fertilization and oocyte meiosis, at two successive stages.
formalpara.para: Drawings, from Hertwig (1920).The oocyte nucleus and polar body are to the left, the sperm nucleus to the right. While two pronuclei (female and male) are formed in the wild form, the sperm nucleus stays condensed and does not participate to the development of the pseudogamous form (arrow).
